dmca.title: Unauthorized Use of Copyrighted Materials
dmca.body:
_____  

From: AMPaquette@aol.com [mailto:AMPaquette@aol.com] 
Sent: Tuesday, April 19, 2005 10:05 AM
To: copyright@theplanet.com
Cc: AMPaquette@aol.com
Subject: Unauthorized Use of Copyrighted Materials


Dear Sir/Madam:

     Our office represents Religious Technology Center ("RTC"), a non-profit
religious
corporation located in Los Angeles, California, with respect to intellectual
property
matters.   RTC is the owner of the confidential Advanced Technology of the
Scientology
religion and the holder of exclusive rights under the copyrights applicable
to the
Advanced Technology materials.  The Advanced Technology materials are
confidential,
unpublished, copyrighted works.  RTC's works include, among others, the
individual
works comprising a level known as "OT III".  These works are registered with
the United
States Copyright Office under registration number: TXu 290 496.

     We have been advised that one of The Planet's subscribers has placed
RTC's OT
III copyrighted works on The Planet's web site without its authorization.
These works
can be found under the following URLs:

     http://www.anti-scientologie.ch/images/croyance-lrh.jpg          
     http://www.anti-scientologie.ch/images/croyance-ot3.jpg
     http://www.anti-scientologie.ch/nouveau_fichier110.htm
     http://www.anti-scientologie.ch/nouveau_xxxx.htm#H

     Your subscriber's action in this regard violates United States
copyright law. 
Accordingly, we request your help in removing these copyrighted works.
  
     Our clients have obtained numerous permanent injunctions concerning
Internet
infringements of this and similar works.  In RTC v. Lerma, Case No.
95-1107-A, the court
ruled in favor of RTC, permanently enjoining the defendant infringer from
posting on the
Internet, the same OT III work that is the subject of this letter.  A jury
in the United States
District Court in San Jose, California assessed damages in the amount of
$75,000 against
a Mr. Henson for copyright infringement, for posting another of RTC's "OT"
works on
the Internet.  Mr. Henson was also permanently enjoined by the court against
further
infringements. Three other United States courts have issued permanent
injunctions
against Internet infringements of these and related works.
     
     I have a good faith belief and in fact, know for certain, that the
posting of these
works through your system was not authorized by my client, any agent of my
client, or
the law.

     I declare under penalty of perjury that this information is accurate
and that I am
authorized to act on behalf of RTC in this matter.

     I appreciate your help and prompt attention to this matter.

Sincerely,
Ava Paquette
Moxon & Kobrin
3055 Wilshire Boulevard
Suite 900
Los Angeles, California 90010

Fax: (213) 487-5385
